get.description:
Cost: 0 credit / successful request.
Get the profile picture of a person.

Profile pictures are served from cached people profiles found within [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb).
If the profile does not exist within [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb), then the API will return a `404` status code.

tmp_profile_pic_url.description:
Temporary URL to the profile picture (valid for just 30 minutes).
            See this [blog post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-is-the-api-returning-s3-links-for-profile-pictures-scraped-from-linkedin-profiles/) for more information.

parameters.name: linkedin_person_profile_url
parameters.description: LinkedIn Profile URL of the person that you are trying to get the profile picture of.

get.description:
Cost: 3 credits / successful request.
Resolve LinkedIn Profile from a work email address

parameters.name: work_email
parameters.description: Work email address of the user

get.description:
Cost: 1 credit / contact number returned.
Given an LinkedIn profile, returns a list of personal contact numbers belonging to this identity.

parameters.name: linkedin_profile_url
parameters.description: LinkedIn Profile URL of the person you want to extract personal contact numbers from.

get.description:
Cost: 3 credits / request.
Lookup work email address of a LinkedIn Person Profile.

Email addresses returned are verified to not be role-based or catch-all emails. Email addresses
returned by our API endpoint come with a 95+% deliverability guarantee

**Endpoint behavior**

*This endpoint* **_may not_** *return results immediately.*

If you provided a webhook in your request parameter, our application will call your webhook with
the result once. See `Webhook request` below.

email_queue_count.description: Total queue in the email extraction process

parameters.name: linkedin_profile_url
parameters.description:
Linkedin Profile URL of the person you want to
    extract work email address from.

parameters.name: callback_url
parameters.description:
Webhook to notify your application when
    the request has finished processing.

get.description:
Cost: 1 credit / successful request.
Get structured data of a LinkedIn School Profile

linkedin_internal_id.description: LinkedIn's Internal and immutable ID of this Company profile.

company_size.description: Listed range of company head count

company_type.description:
Possible values:  

        `EDUCATIONAL`: Educational Institution

        `GOVERNMENT_AGENCY`: Government Agency

        `NON_PROFIT` : Nonprofit

        `PARTNERSHIP` : Partnership

        `PRIVATELY_HELD`: Privately Held

        `PUBLIC_COMPANY`: Public Company

        `SELF_EMPLOYED`: Self-Employed

        `SELF_OWNED`: Sole Proprietorship

tagline.example: Think Different - But Not Too Different

example.text: Introducing Personal Email Lookup API https://lnkd.in/gr7cb5by

article_link.description: The URL for which the post links out to

image.description: The URL to the image to the post (if it exists)

total_likes.description: The total likes a post has received

parameters.name: url
parameters.description:
URL of the LinkedIn School Profile to crawl.

    URL should be in the format of `https://www.linkedin.com/school/<public_identifier>`

parameters.name: use_cache
parameters.description:
`if-present` The default behavior. Fetches profile from cache regardless of age of profile. If profile is not available in cache, API will attempt to source profile externally.

`if-recent` API will make a best effort to return a fresh profile no older than 29 days.Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint.

get.description:
Cost: 10 credits / successful request.
Search employees of a target by their job title.
This API endpoint is syntactic sugar for the role_search parameter under the [Employee Listing Endpoint](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/docs#company-api-employee-listing-endpoint).

Results are limited by data that we have within [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb).
Use [Role Lookup API Endpoint](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/docs#people-api-role-lookup-endpoint) if you need to query for profiles without LinkDB constraints.
The drawbacks of the Role Lookup API Endpoint is that it is less precise and can return at most one result per query.

public_identifier.description:
The vanity identifier of the public LinkedIn profile.
                The vanity identifier comes after the `/in/` part of the LinkedIn Profile URL
                in the following format: `https://www.linkedin.com/in/<public_identifier>`

profile_pic_url.description:
A temporary link to the user's profile picture that is valid for 30 minutes. 
                The temporal nature of the link is by design to prevent having Proxycurl be the mirror for the images.
                The developer is expected to handle these images by downloading the image and re-hosting the image.
                See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-is-the-api-returning-s3-links-for-profile-pictures-scraped-from-linkedin-profiles/) for context.
                Some profile pictures might be of the standard LinkedIn's profile picture placeholder. It is so because. See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-do-most-linkedin-profiles-fetched-via-the-person-profile-endpoint-return-a-placeholder-profile-picture/) for context.

background_cover_image_url.description:
A temporary link to the user's background cover picture
                that is valid for 30 minutes.
                The temporal nature of the link is by design to prevent
                having Proxycurl be the mirror for the images.
                The developer is expected to handle these images 
                by downloading the image and re-hosting the image. 
                See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-is-the-api-returning-s3-links-for-profile-pictures-scraped-from-linkedin-profiles/) for context.

occupation.description: The title and company name of the user's current employment.

headline.description: The tagline written by the user for his profile.

summary.description: A blurb (longer than the tagline) written by the user for his profile.

country.description:
The user's country of residence depicted by
                a 2-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

country_full_name.description: The user's country of residence, in English words.

city.description: The city that the user is living at.

state.description: The state that the user is living at.

experiences.description: The user's list of historic work experiences.

education.description: The user's list of education background.

languages.description:
A list of languages that the user claims to be familiar with,
                and has added to his/her profile.
                Do note that we do not have the proficiency level as
                that data point is not available on a public LinkedIn profile.

accomplishment_organisations.description: List of noteworthy organizations that this user is part of.

accomplishment_publications.description: List of noteworthy publications that this user has partook in.

example.name: Nobel Peace Prize
example.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit

accomplishment_honors_awards.description: List of noteworthy honours and awards that this user has won.

example.title: Nobel Peace Prize
example.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit

accomplishment_patents.description: List of noteworthy patents won by this user.

example.title: The art of war
example.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit

accomplishment_courses.description: List of noteworthy courses partook by this user.

accomplishment_projects.description: List of noteworthy projects undertaken by this user.

accomplishment_test_scores.description: List of noteworthy test scores accomplished by this user.

volunteer_work.description: List of historic volunteer work experiences.

certifications.description: List of noteworthy certifications accomplished by this user.

people_also_viewed.description: A list of other LinkedIn profiles closely related to this user.

recommendations.description: List of recommendations made by other users about this profile.
example: Professional and dedicated approach towards clients and collegues.

activities.description: A list of LinkedIn status activities.

similarly_named_profiles.description: A list of other LinkedIn profiles with similar names.

articles.description: A list of content-based articles posted by this user.

groups.description: A list of LinkedIn groups that this user is a part of.",

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Tune the maximum results returned per API call.
    The default value of this parameter is `200000`.
    Accepted values for this parameter is an integer ranging from `1` to `200000`.

parameters.name: linkedin_company_profile_url
parameters.description: LinkedIn Profile URL of the target company.

parameters.name: keyword_regex
parameters.description: Job title keyword to search for in regular expression format.

get.description:
Cost: 3 credits / employee returned.
Get a list of employees of a Company.

This API endpoint is limited by LinkDB which is populated with profiles in the US, UK, Canada, Israel, Australia, Ireland, New Zealand and Singapore.
As such, this endpoint is best used to list employees working in companies based in those locations only.

public_identifier.description:
The vanity identifier of the public LinkedIn profile.
                The vanity identifier comes after the `/in/` part of the LinkedIn Profile URL
                in the following format: `https://www.linkedin.com/in/<public_identifier>`

profile_pic_url.description:
A temporary link to the user's profile picture that is valid for 30 minutes. 
                The temporal nature of the link is by design to prevent having Proxycurl be the mirror for the images.
                The developer is expected to handle these images by downloading the image and re-hosting the image.
                See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-is-the-api-returning-s3-links-for-profile-pictures-scraped-from-linkedin-profiles/) for context.
                Some profile pictures might be of the standard LinkedIn's profile picture placeholder. It is so because. See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-do-most-linkedin-profiles-fetched-via-the-person-profile-endpoint-return-a-placeholder-profile-picture/) for context.

background_cover_image_url.description:
A temporary link to the user's background cover picture
                that is valid for 30 minutes.
                The temporal nature of the link is by design to prevent
                having Proxycurl be the mirror for the images.
                The developer is expected to handle these images 
                by downloading the image and re-hosting the image. 
                See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-is-the-api-returning-s3-links-for-profile-pictures-scraped-from-linkedin-profiles/) for context.

articles.description: A list of content-based articles posted by this user.

groups.description: A list of LinkedIn groups that this user is a part of.",

parameters.name: country
parameters.description:
Limit the result set to the country locality of the profile. For example, set the parameter of `country=us` if you only want profiles from the US.

    This parameter accepts a **case-insensitive** [Alpha-2 ISO3166 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2).

    Costs an extra `3` credit per result returned.

parameters.name: enrich_profiles
parameters.description:
Get the full profile of employees instead of only their profile urls.

    Each request respond with a streaming response of profiles.

    The valid values are:
    
    * `skip` (default): lists employee's profile url
    * `enrich`: lists full profile of employees

    Calling this API endpoint with this parameter would add `1` credit per employee returned.

parameters.name: role_search
parameters.description:
Filter employees by their title by matching the employee's title against a *regular expression*.

    The default value of this parameter is `null`.

    The accepted value is a *regular expression* (regex).

    (The base cost of calling this API endpoint with this parameter would be `10` credits.
    Each employee matched and returned would cost `6` credits per employee returned.)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Tune the maximum results returned per API call.

    The default value of this parameter is `200000`.

    Accepted values for this parameter is an integer ranging from `1` to `200000`.

    When `enrich_profiles=enrich`, this parameter accepts value ranging from `1` to `100`.

parameters.name: employment_status
parameters.description:
Parameter to tell the API to return past or current employees.

    Valid values are `current`, `past`, and `all`:

    * `current` (default) : lists current employees
    * `past` : lists past employees
    * `all` : lists current & past employees

parameters.name: resolve_numeric_id
parameters.description:
Enable support for Company Profile URLs with numerical IDs that you most frequently fetch from Sales Navigator. 
    We achieve this by resolving numerical IDs into vanity IDs with cached company profiles from [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb). 
    For example, we will turn `https://www.linkedin.com/company/1234567890` to `https://www.linkedin.com/company/acme-corp` -- for which the API endpoint only supports the latter.
    
    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `false` (default value) - Will not resolve numerical IDs.
    - `true` - Enable support for Company Profile URLs with numerical IDs. 
    Costs an extra `2` credit on top of the base cost of the endpoint.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description:
URL of the LinkedIn Company Profile to target.

    URL should be in the format of `https://www.linkedin.com/company/<public_identifier>`

get.description:
Cost: 0 credit / request.
Given an email address, checks if the email address belongs to a disposable email service.

is_disposable_email.description: Returns a boolean value of the disposable nature of the given email address

is_free_email.description: Returns a boolean value of the free status of the given email address

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address to check

get.description:
Cost: 1 credit / successful request.
Get structured data of a Company Profile

linkedin_internal_id.description: LinkedIn's Internal and immutable ID of this Company profile.

company_size.description: Listed range of company head count

company_type.description:
Possible values:  

        `EDUCATIONAL`: Educational Institution

        `GOVERNMENT_AGENCY`: Government Agency

        `NON_PROFIT` : Nonprofit

        `PARTNERSHIP` : Partnership

        `PRIVATELY_HELD`: Privately Held

        `SELF_OWNED`: Sole Proprietorship

example.text: Introducing Personal Email Lookup API https://lnkd.in/gr7cb5by

article_link.description: The URL for which the post links out to

image.description: The URL to the image to the post (if it exists)

total_likes.description: The total likes a post has received

linkedin_profile_url.description: LinkedIn Company Profile URL of company that was involved

crunchbase_profile_url.description: Crunchbase Profile URL of company that was involved

announced_date.description: Date by which this event was announced

linkedin_profile_url.description: LinkedIn Company Profile URL of company that was involved

crunchbase_profile_url.description: Crunchbase Profile URL of company that was involved

announced_date.description: Date by which this event was announced

linkedin_profile_url.description: LinkedIn Profile URL of the company that has exited

crunchbase_profile_url.description: Crunchbase Profile URL of the company that has exited

crunchbase_rank.description: A measure of prominence of this company by Crunchbase

operating_status.description: Status of the company's operational status

contact_email.description: General contact email of the company

phone_number.description: General contact number of the company

facebook_id.description: ID of the company's official Facebook account

twitter_id.description: ID of the company's official Twitter account

number_of_funding_rounds.description: Total rounds of funding that this company has raised

total_funding_amount.description: Total venture capital raised by this company

stock_symbol.description: Stock symbol of this public company

ipo_date.description: The date by which this public company went public

total_fund_raised.description: The total amount of funds raised (by this VC firm) to be deployed as subsidiary investments (applicable only for VC firms)

number_of_investments.description: Total investments made by this VC firm (applicable only for VC firms)

number_of_lead_investments.description: Total investments that was led by this VC firm (applicable only for VC firms)

number_of_exits.description: Total exits by this VC (applicable only for VC firms)

number_of_acquisitions.description: Total companies acquired by this company

number_of_investor.description: Number of investors in this round

parameters.name: resolve_numeric_id
parameters.description:
Enable support for Company Profile URLs with numerical IDs that you most frequently fetch from Sales Navigator. 
    We achieve this by resolving numerical IDs into vanity IDs with cached company profiles from [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb). 
    For example, we will turn `https://www.linkedin.com/company/1234567890` to `https://www.linkedin.com/company/acme-corp` -- for which the API endpoint only supports the latter.
    
    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `false` (default value) - Will not resolve numerical IDs.
    - `true` - Enable support for Company Profile URLs with numerical IDs. 
    Costs an extra `2` credit on top of the base cost of the endpoint.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description:
Appends categories data of this company.

    Default value is `"exclude"`.
    The other acceptable value is `"include"`, which will include these categories (if available) for `1` extra credit.

parameters.name: funding_data
parameters.description:
Returns a list of funding rounds that this company has received.

    Default value is `"exclude"`.
    The other acceptable value is `"include"`, which will include these categories (if available) for `1` extra credit.

parameters.name: extra
parameters.description:
Enriches the Company Profile with extra details from external sources. Details include Crunchbase ranking, contact email, phone number, Facebook account, Twitter account, funding rounds and amount, IPO status, investor information, etc.
    
    Default value is `"exclude"`.
    The other acceptable value is `"include"`, which will include these extra details (if available) for `1` extra credit.

parameters.name: exit_data
parameters.description:
Returns a list of investment portfolio exits.

    Default value is `"exclude"`.
    The other acceptable value is `"include"`, which will include these categories (if available) for `1` extra credit.

parameters.name: acquisitions
parameters.description:
Provides further enriched data on acquisitions made by this company from external sources.

    Default value is `"exclude"`.
    The other acceptable value is `"include"`, which will include these acquisition data (if available) for `1` extra credit.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description:
URL of the LinkedIn Company Profile to crawl.

    URL should be in the format of `https://www.linkedin.com/company/<public_identifier>`

parameters.name: use_cache
parameters.description:
`if-present` The default behavior. Fetches profile from cache regardless of age of profile. If profile is not available in cache, API will attempt to source profile externally.

`if-recent` API will make a best effort to return a fresh profile no older than 29 days.Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint.

get.description:
Cost: 2 credits / successful request.
Resolve Company LinkedIn Profile from company name,
    domain name and location.

parameters.name: company_location
parameters.description:
The location / region of company.
    ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes

parameters.name: company_domain
parameters.description:
Company website or Company domain
Requires either `company_domain` or `company_name`

parameters.name: company_name
parameters.description:
Company Name
Requires either `company_domain` or `company_name`

get.description:
Cost: 2 credits / successful request.

parameters.description:
URL of the LinkedIn Job Profile to target.

    URL should be in the format of
    `https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/<job_id>`.
    [Jobs Listing Endpoint](#jobs-api-jobs-listing-endpoint)
    can be used to retrieve a job URL.

get.description:

Get a list of students of a school or university.

students.description: A list of student profiles (if enriched) and their associated profile URL.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description:
Limit the result set to the country locality of the profile. For example, set the parameter of `country=us` if you only want profiles from the US.

    This parameter accepts a **case-insensitive** [Alpha-2 ISO3166 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2).

    Costs an extra `3` credit per result returned.

parameters.name: enrich_profiles
parameters.description:
Get the full profile of students instead of only their profile urls.

    Each request respond with a streaming response of profiles.

    The valid values are:
    
    * `skip` (default): lists student's profile url
    * `enrich`: lists full profile of students

    *Calling this API endpoint with this parameter would add `1` credit per student returned.*

parameters.name: search_keyword
parameters.description:
Filter students by their major by matching the student's major against a *regular expression*.

    The default value of this parameter is `null`.

    The accepted value is a *regular expression* (regex).

    (The base cost of calling this API endpoint with this parameter would be `10` credits.
    Each student matched and returned would cost `6` credits per student returned.)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Tune the maximum results returned per API call.

    The default value of this parameter is `200000`.

    Accepted values for this parameter is an integer ranging from `1` to `200000`.

    When `enrich_profiles=enrich`, this parameter accepts value ranging from `1` to `100`.

parameters.name: student_status
parameters.description:
Parameter to tell the API to return past or current students.

    Valid values are `current`, `past`, and `all`:

    * `current` (default) : lists current students
    * `past` : lists past students
    * `all` : lists current & past students

parameters.name: resolve_numeric_id
parameters.description:
Enable support for School Profile URLs with numerical IDs that you most frequently fetch from Sales Navigator. 
    We achieve this by resolving numerical IDs into vanity IDs with cached company profiles from [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb). 
    For example, we will turn `https://www.linkedin.com/school/1234567890` to `https://www.linkedin.com/school/acme-corp` -- for which the API endpoint only supports the latter.
    
    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `false` (default value) - Will not resolve numerical IDs.
    - `true` - Enable support for School Profile URLs with numerical IDs. 
    Costs an extra `2` credit on top of the base cost of the endpoint.

parameters.name: linkedin_school_url
parameters.description:
URL of the LinkedIn School Profile to target.

    URL should be in the format of `https://www.linkedin.com/school/<public_identifier>`

get.description:
Cost: 1 credit / email returned.
Given an LinkedIn profile, returns a list of personal emails belonging to this identity. Emails are verified to be deliverable.

invalid_emails.description: A list of invalid personal emails

parameters.name: email_validation
parameters.description:
Perform deliverability validation on each email. (Costs 1 extra credit per email found).
    
    Takes the following values:
     * include - Perform email validation.
     * exclude (default) - Do not perform email validation.

parameters.name: linkedin_profile_url
parameters.description: LinkedIn Profile URL of the person you want to extract personal email addresses from.

get.description:
Cost: 2 credits / successful request.
List jobs posted by a company on LinkedIn

parameters.name: when
parameters.description:
The time when the job is posted,
    It accepts the following case-insensitive values only:
    - `yesterday`
    - `past-week`
    - `past-month`
    - `anytime` (default)

parameters.name: flexibility
parameters.description:
The flexibility of the job.
    It accepts the following 3 case insensitive values only:
    - `remote`
    - `on-site`
    - `hybrid`
    - `anything` (default)

parameters.name: geo_id
parameters.description:
The `geo_id` of the location to search for.
    For example, `92000000` is the `geo_id` of world wide.

    See [this article](https://nubela.co/blog/how-to-fetch-geo_id-parameter-for-the-job-api/?utm_source=blog&utm_medium=web&utm_campaign=docs-redirect-to-geo_id-article) as to how you may be able to match regions to `geo_id` input values.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: The keyword to search for.

parameters.name: search_id
parameters.description:
The `search_id` of the company on LinkedIn.
    You can get the `search_id` of a LinkedIn company via
    [Company Profile API](#company-api-company-profile-endpoint).

get.description:
Cost: 1 credit / successful request.
Get a number of total employees of a Company.

Get an employee count of this company from various sources.

linkedin_employee_count.description: The scraped value of employee count of this company from it's LinkedIn profile. This value does not respect `employement_status` parameter. It will always return the curent employee count of this company from LinkedIn.

linkdb_employee_count.description: The total number of employees found in LinkDB for this company. This value is limited by pre-crawled LinkedIn profiles stored in [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb)

regression_notice.default: Hello developer, we have renamed `total_employee` key to `linkdb_employee_count` to fix the bad grammar. We have kept `total_employee` for backwards compatibility, so please do not use it as we will remove it down the road. To see which keys are officially supported, refer to our API docs at https://nubela.co/proxycurl/docs#company-api-employee-count-endpoint

parameters.name: linkedin_employee_count
parameters.description:
Option to include a scraped employee count value from the target company's LinkedIn profile.

    Valid values are `include` and `exclude`:

    * `exclude` (default) : To exclude the scraped employee count.
    * `include` : To include the scraped employee count.

    Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the base cost of the endpoint.

parameters.name: employment_status
parameters.description:
Parameter to tell the API to filter past or current employees.

    Valid values are `current`, `past`, and `all`:

    * `current` (default) : count current employees
    * `past` : count past employees
    * `all` : count current & past employees

parameters.name: url
parameters.description:
URL of the LinkedIn Company Profile to target.

    URL should be in the format of `https://www.linkedin.com/company/<public_identifier>`

get.description:
Cost: 1 credit / successful request.
Get structured data of a Personal Profile

public_identifier.description: The vanity identifier of the public LinkedIn profile. The vanity identifier comes after the `/in/` part of the LinkedIn Profile URL in the following format: `https://www.linkedin.com/in/<public_identifier>`

profile_pic_url.description:
A temporary link to the user's profile picture that is valid for 30 minutes. The temporal nature of the link is by design to prevent having Proxycurl be the mirror for the images. The developer is expected to handle these images by downloading the image and re-hosting the image. See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-is-the-api-returning-s3-links-for-profile-pictures-scraped-from-linkedin-profiles/) for context.
                
                Some profile pictures might be of the standard LinkedIn's profile picture placeholder. It is so because. See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-do-most-linkedin-profiles-fetched-via-the-person-profile-endpoint-return-a-placeholder-profile-picture/) for context.

background_cover_image_url.description: A temporary link to the user's background cover picture that is valid for 30 minutes. The temporal nature of the link is by design to prevent having Proxycurl be the mirror for the images. The developer is expected to handle these images by downloading the image and re-hosting the image. See [this post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-is-the-api-returning-s3-links-for-profile-pictures-scraped-from-linkedin-profiles/) for context.

occupation.description: The title and company name of the user's current employment.

headline.description: The tagline written by the user for his profile.

summary.description: A blurb (longer than the tagline) written by the user for his profile.

country.description: The user's country of residence depicted by a 2-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

country_full_name.description: The user's country of residence, in English words.

city.description: The city that the user is living at.

state.description: The state that the user is living at.

experiences.description: The user's list of historic work experiences.

company_linkedin_profile_url.description:
The company's profile URL.

        If present, could be used with [Company Profile Endpoint](#company-api-company-profile-endpoint) for more info.

logo_url.description: URL of the logo of the organisation.

education.description: The user's list of education background.

languages.description:
A list of languages that the user claims to be familiar with, and has added to his/her profile.
                
                Do note that we do not have the proficiency level as that data point is not available on a public LinkedIn profile.

accomplishment_organisations.description: List of noteworthy organizations that this user is part of.

accomplishment_publications.description: List of noteworthy publications that this user has partook in.

example.name: Nobel Peace Prize
example.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit

accomplishment_honors_awards.description: List of noteworthy honours and awards that this user has won.

example.title: Nobel Peace Prize
example.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit

issuer.description: The organisation body issuing this honour/award.

issued_on.description: Date that this honour/awared was issued.

accomplishment_patents.description: List of noteworthy patents won by this user.

example.title: The art of war
example.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit

issuer.description: The organisation body that issued the patent.

application_number.description: Numerical representation that identifies the patent.

accomplishment_courses.description: List of noteworthy courses partook by this user.

number.description: The numerical representation of the course

accomplishment_projects.description: List of noteworthy projects undertaken by this user.

title.description: Name of the project that has been or is currently being worked on.

url.description: A web location related to the project.

accomplishment_test_scores.description: List of noteworthy test scores accomplished by this user.

name.description: Title of the course for which test score was derived from.

volunteer_work.description: List of historic volunteer work experiences.

company_linkedin_profile_url.description:
The company's profile URL.

        If present, could be used with [Company Profile Endpoint](#company-api-company-profile-endpoint) for more info.

logo_url.description: URL of the logo of the organisation.

certifications.description: List of noteworthy certifications accomplished by this user.

name.description: Name of the course or program.

authority.description: The organisation body issuing this certificate.

people_also_viewed.description: A list of other LinkedIn profiles closely related to this user.

link.description:
URL of the profile.

        Useable with [Person profile endpoint](#people-api-person-profile-endpoint)

recommendations.description: List of recommendations made by other users about this profile.
example: Professional and dedicated approach towards clients and collegues.

activities.description: A list of LinkedIn status activities.

similarly_named_profiles.description: A list of other LinkedIn profiles with similar names.

articles.description: A list of content-based articles posted by this user.

groups.description: A list of LinkedIn groups that this user is a part of.

profile_pic_url.description: The URL to the profile picture of this LinkedIn Group

name.description: Name of LinkedIn group for which this user is in

skills.description: A list of keyword-based skills that this user boasts of on his LinkedIn profile.

inferred_salary.description: A salary range inferred from the user's current job title and company.

industry.description: Industry that the user works in.

interests.description: A list of interests that the user has.

extra.description: A bundle of extra data on this user.

personal_emails.description: A list of personal emails associated with this user.

personal_numbers.description: A list of personal mobile phone numbers associated with this user.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description:
URL of the LinkedIn Profile to crawl.

    URL should be in the format of `https://www.linkedin.com/in/<public-identifier>`

parameters.name: fallback_to_cache
parameters.description:
Tweaks the fallback behavior if an error arises from fetching a fresh profile.
    
    This parameter accepts the following values:
    * `on-error` (default value) - Fallback to reading the profile from cache if an error arises.
    * `never` - Do not ever read profile from cache.

parameters.name: use_cache
parameters.description:
`if-present` The default behavior. Fetches profile from cache regardless of age of profile. If profile is not available in cache, API will attempt to source profile externally.

`if-recent` API will make a best effort to return a fresh profile no older than 29 days.Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint.

parameters.name: skills
parameters.description:
Include skills data from external sources.

    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `exclude` (default value) - Does not provide skills data field.
    - `include` - Append skills data to the person profile object. Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint (if data is available).

parameters.name: inferred_salary
parameters.description:
Include inferred salary range from external sources.

    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `exclude` (default value) - Does not provide inferred salary data field.
    - `include` - Append inferred salary range data to the person profile object. Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint (if data is available).

parameters.name: personal_email
parameters.description:
Enriches the Person Profile with personal emails from external sources.

    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `exclude` (default value) - Does not provide personal emails data field.
    - `include` - Append personal emails data to the person profile object. Costs an extra `1` credit per email returned on top of the cost of the base endpoint (if data is available).

parameters.name: personal_contact_number
parameters.description:
Enriches the Person Profile with personal numbers from external sources.

    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `exclude` (default value) - Does not provide personal numbers data field.
    - `include` - Append personal numbers data to the person profile object. Costs an extra `1` credit per email returned on top of the cost of the base endpoint (if data is available).

parameters.name: twitter_profile_id
parameters.description:
Enriches the Person Profile with Twitter Id from external sources.

    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `exclude` (default value) - Does not provide Twitter Id data field.
    - `include` - Append Twitter Id data to the person profile object. Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint (if data is available).

parameters.name: facebook_profile_id
parameters.description:
Enriches the Person Profile with Facebook Id from external sources.

    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `exclude` (default value) - Does not provide Facebook Id data field.
    - `include` - Append Facebook Id data to the person profile object. Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint (if data is available).

parameters.name: github_profile_id
parameters.description:
Enriches the Person Profile with Github Id from external sources.

    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `exclude` (default value) - Does not provide Github Id data field.
    - `include` - Append Github Id data to the person profile object. Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint (if data is available).

parameters.name: extra
parameters.description:
Enriches the Person Profile with extra details from external sources. Extra details include gender, birth date, industry and interests.

    This parameter accepts the following values:
    - `exclude` (default value) - Does not provide extra data field.
    - `include` - Append extra data to the person profile object. Costs an extra `1` credit on top of the cost of the base endpoint (if data is available).

get.description:
Cost: 3 credits / successful request.
Finds the closest (person) profile with a given role in a Company.
For example, you can use this endpoint to find the "CTO" of "Apple".
This API endpoint returns only one result that is the closest match.

There is also the [Employee Search Endpoint](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/docs#company-api-employee-search-api-endpoint) which is powered by [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb) if you require:

* precision on the target company
* a list of employees that matches a role (instead of one result).

linkedin_profile_url.description: LinkedIn Profile URL of the person that most closely matches the role

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Role of the profile that you are lookin up

parameters.name: company_name
parameters.description: Name of the company that you are searching for

get.description:
Cost: 2 credits / successful request.
Count number of jobs posted by a company on LinkedIn

parameters.name: when
parameters.description:
The time when the job is posted,
    It accepts the following case-insensitive values only:
    - `yesterday`
    - `past-week`
    - `past-month`
    - `anytime` (default)

parameters.name: flexibility
parameters.description:
The flexibility of the job.
    It accepts the following 3 case insensitive values only:
    - `remote`
    - `on-site`
    - `hybrid`
    - `anything` (default)

parameters.name: geo_id
parameters.description:
The `geo_id` of the location to search for.
    For example, `92000000` is the `geo_id` of world wide.

    See [this article](https://nubela.co/blog/how-to-fetch-geo_id-parameter-for-the-job-api/?utm_source=blog&utm_medium=web&utm_campaign=docs-redirect-to-geo_id-article) as to how you may be able to match regions to `geo_id` input values.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: The keyword to search for.

parameters.name: search_id
parameters.description:
The `search_id` of the company on LinkedIn.
    You can get the `search_id` of a LinkedIn company via
    [Company Profile API](#company-api-company-profile-endpoint).

get.description:
Cost: 0 credit / successful request.
Get the profile picture of a company.

Profile pictures are served from cached company profiles found within [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb).
If the profile does not exist within [LinkDB](https://nubela.co/proxycurl/linkdb), then the API will return a `404` status code.

tmp_profile_pic_url.description:
Temporary URL to the profile picture (valid for just 30 minutes).
            See this [blog post](https://nubela.co/blog/why-is-the-api-returning-s3-links-for-profile-pictures-scraped-from-linkedin-profiles/) for more information.

parameters.name: linkedin_company_profile_url
parameters.description: LinkedIn Profile URL of the company that you are trying to get the profile picture of.
